assessment.title: AI Maturity Self-Assessment Framework
assessment.subtitle: Strategic Agentic AI Transformation Assessment
assessment.description: This comprehensive assessment evaluates your organization's maturity in adopting agentic AI technologies focused on process automation and customer experience enhancement. Unlike traditional analytics or machine learning assessments, this framework specifically addresses autonomous AI agents that can take actions and make decisions.

maturityLevels.name: Tactical/Experimental
maturityLevels.description: Limited AI awareness, isolated pilot projects, no systematic approach

maturityLevels.name: Emerging Strategic
maturityLevels.description: Growing AI awareness, some coordination, beginning systematic approach

maturityLevels.name: Strategic
maturityLevels.description: Systematic AI implementation, coordinated approach, measurable value

maturityLevels.name: Becoming Transformational
maturityLevels.description: Advanced AI capabilities, enterprise-wide adoption, significant impact

maturityLevels.name: Transformational
maturityLevels.description: AI-driven innovation, industry leadership, continuous evolution

domains.name: Strategy
domains.description: Executive leadership, strategic vision, and value-driven AI transformation

questions.title: C-Suite AI Sponsorship
questions.question: How visible and active is your executive leadership in championing AI initiatives?

options.text: Limited executive awareness of AI potential; no dedicated champion or visible leadership support for AI initiatives
Some executive interest in AI but inconsistent support; occasional executive mentions in communications but no dedicated resources
Clear executive champion identified; regular C-suite discussions about AI strategy with some dedicated budget allocation
CEO and multiple C-suite leaders actively promote AI; visible leadership participation in AI initiatives and regular organizational communication
Entire C-suite champions AI as core business strategy; AI leadership integrated into all major business decisions and strategic planning processes

questions.title: AI Strategic Integration
questions.question: How well is AI integrated into your overall business strategy and long-term planning?

options.text: AI considered as separate technology experiment; no integration with business strategy or planning cycles
AI mentioned in strategic documents but not integrated into core business planning; viewed as technology initiative rather than business strategy
AI strategy exists and aligns with business objectives; AI considerations included in annual planning and major business decisions
AI deeply embedded in business strategy; AI transformation roadmap aligns with overall business transformation goals
AI-first strategic mindset drives all business planning; competitive strategy built around AI capabilities and innovation

questions.title: Value-Driven Use Case Implementation
questions.question: How many high-impact, production-ready AI use cases has your organization successfully implemented?

options.text: No production AI use cases; limited to pilot projects or proof-of-concepts without business impact measurement
1-2 pilot projects showing some promise; beginning to measure ROI but limited organizational impact
2-3 use cases successfully deployed in production with measurable business value and positive ROI
3-5 use cases scaled across multiple business functions with significant operational impact and revenue influence
5+ use cases driving enterprise transformation; AI capabilities directly influence business model and competitive positioning

questions.title: AI Transformation Roadmap
questions.question: How comprehensive is your plan for scaling AI from pilots to enterprise-wide adoption?

options.text: No formal roadmap; ad-hoc project approach without clear progression or scaling strategy
Basic roadmap exists for current pilots; limited visibility into enterprise-wide scaling approach
Comprehensive 2-3 year roadmap with clear phases, milestones, and resource allocation for AI scaling
Detailed transformation roadmap integrated with business strategy; clear path from current state to AI-driven organization
Dynamic roadmap continuously updated based on AI innovation; roadmap drives industry leadership and competitive advantage

questions.title: Innovation Culture and Experimentation
questions.question: How embedded is AI innovation and experimentation in your organizational culture?

options.text: Risk-averse culture with minimal AI experimentation; innovation limited to traditional approaches
Some tolerance for AI experimentation; occasional innovation initiatives but not systematic or culturally embedded
Culture encourages AI innovation; dedicated time and resources for experimentation with systematic learning processes
Innovation culture deeply embedded; employees actively seek AI solutions and experimentation is rewarded
AI-first innovation culture; continuous experimentation drives business evolution and industry leadership

domains.name: Technology
domains.description: Infrastructure, platforms, and technical capabilities for agentic AI

questions.title: AI Infrastructure Readiness
questions.question: How mature is your technical infrastructure to support scalable AI automation and deployment?

options.text: Limited technical infrastructure; reliance on manual processes with basic digital tools and siloed systems
Some cloud adoption and digital infrastructure; beginning to standardize platforms but limited integration
Robust cloud infrastructure with API-driven architecture; standardized platforms enabling AI integration and automation
Advanced cloud-native infrastructure designed for AI workloads; automated deployment capabilities and scalable architecture
Cutting-edge infrastructure optimized for AI innovation; self-managing systems with advanced automation and real-time adaptability

questions.title: Automation Platform Maturity
questions.question: What level of automation exists in your core business processes and where do these automation efforts reside organizationally?

options.text: Manual processes dominate; limited automation tools with no centralized coordination or strategy
Basic process automation in some areas; beginning to identify where automation efforts should be centralized
Systematic automation program with dedicated team or center; standardized approach to process automation across functions
Advanced automation platform with AI integration; centralized automation center driving enterprise-wide efficiency
Intelligent automation ecosystem with agentic AI; self-optimizing processes and autonomous decision-making capabilities

questions.title: Platform Flexibility and Integration
questions.question: How flexible and vendor-agnostic is your technology platform for AI implementation?

options.text: Heavily dependent on single vendor ecosystem; limited flexibility for AI tool integration
Some platform diversity but still constrained by vendor dependencies; beginning to evaluate integration options
Multi-vendor approach with API-driven integration; flexibility to adopt best-of-breed AI solutions
Open, flexible platform architecture; seamless integration of diverse AI tools and services
Fully agnostic platform ecosystem; dynamic integration capabilities that adapt to emerging AI technologies

questions.title: Data Quality and Accessibility
questions.question: How accessible and high-quality is your data for supporting AI applications across the organization?

options.text: Poor data quality with difficult access; siloed data systems limiting AI potential
Improving data quality initiatives; some data integration but still significant barriers to AI applications
Good data quality with established governance; accessible data architecture supporting most AI use cases
High-quality, real-time data ecosystem; seamless data access enabling advanced AI applications
Exceptional data quality with intelligent data management; self-healing data systems optimized for AI innovation

questions.title: AI Development and Deployment Capabilities
questions.question: How advanced are your capabilities for developing, testing, and deploying AI solutions?

options.text: No formal AI development capabilities; reliance on external vendors for any AI implementation
Basic AI development skills; limited internal capabilities with heavy vendor dependence for complex solutions
Established AI development team; standardized processes for building and deploying AI solutions
Advanced AI development capabilities; automated testing and deployment with continuous integration
World-class AI development ecosystem; rapid prototyping, automated optimization, and intelligent deployment systems

domains.name: Governance
domains.description: Risk management, ethics, compliance, and AI oversight

questions.title: Comprehensive AI Risk Management
questions.question: How effectively does your organization manage AI risks across performance, security, control, economic, societal, and enterprise categories?

options.text: Limited awareness of AI-specific risks; no formal risk assessment or mitigation strategies for AI implementations
Basic understanding of AI risks; ad-hoc risk assessment for individual projects without comprehensive framework
Formal AI risk framework addressing key categories; systematic risk assessment and mitigation for AI initiatives
Comprehensive AI risk management covering all risk categories; continuous monitoring and adaptive risk strategies
Advanced AI risk intelligence; predictive risk management with automated monitoring and dynamic mitigation strategies

questions.title: AI Governance Structure and Oversight
questions.question: What governance structures exist for AI decision-making, oversight, and accountability throughout the AI lifecycle?

options.text: No formal AI governance structure; decisions made ad-hoc without clear accountability or oversight
Basic governance for individual AI projects; some oversight but limited organizational structure
Formal AI governance committee with clear roles; systematic oversight for AI initiatives and decision-making processes
Mature AI governance integrated with enterprise governance; clear accountability and comprehensive lifecycle management
Advanced AI governance ecosystem; autonomous governance capabilities with intelligent oversight and dynamic policy adaptation

questions.title: Responsible AI and Ethics Framework
questions.question: How embedded are ethics, fairness, and transparency considerations in your AI development and deployment processes?

options.text: Ethics considered as afterthought; no formal guidelines or systematic approach to responsible AI
Basic ethical guidelines exist; limited implementation and monitoring of responsible AI practices
Comprehensive responsible AI framework; systematic implementation of ethical guidelines and bias testing
Advanced responsible AI practices integrated throughout AI lifecycle; continuous monitoring and improvement
Industry-leading responsible AI framework; innovative approaches to AI ethics and transparency driving industry standards

questions.title: Regulatory Compliance and Preparedness
questions.question: How prepared is your organization for current and emerging AI regulatory requirements?

options.text: Limited awareness of AI regulatory landscape; no specific compliance preparation for AI implementations
Basic awareness of AI regulations; beginning to assess compliance requirements for current AI initiatives
Proactive compliance approach; systematic preparation for known AI regulations and compliance monitoring
Advanced regulatory preparedness; anticipating future regulations and building adaptive compliance capabilities
Regulatory leadership position; contributing to regulatory development and setting industry compliance standards

questions.title: Enterprise Governance Integration
questions.question: How well integrated is AI governance with your existing enterprise governance, compliance, and audit functions?

options.text: AI governance operates separately from enterprise governance; limited integration with existing oversight functions
Some coordination with enterprise governance; basic integration with existing compliance and audit processes
AI governance well-integrated with enterprise governance; systematic coordination with compliance, audit, and risk functions
Seamless integration of AI governance with all enterprise oversight functions; unified governance approach
AI governance enhances overall enterprise governance; intelligent governance systems improving all oversight functions

domains.name: People
domains.description: Skills, culture, change management, and organizational readiness

questions.title: AI Literacy and Skills Development
questions.question: What is the current level of AI understanding and skills across your organization?

options.text: Limited AI knowledge across organization; few employees understand AI potential or applications
Basic AI awareness in some areas; beginning to identify skill gaps and training needs
Systematic AI literacy program; role-specific training and growing AI competency across organization
High AI literacy levels; specialized expertise in key roles and widespread understanding of AI applications
Organization-wide AI fluency; employees actively innovate with AI and drive continuous learning and development

questions.title: Change Management for AI Transformation
questions.question: How effectively does your organization manage the human side of AI-driven change?

options.text: Limited change management for AI initiatives; resistance to AI adoption and minimal employee engagement
Basic change management for AI projects; some employee communication but limited systematic approach
Comprehensive change management strategy; systematic employee engagement and support for AI transformation
Excellent change management capabilities; high employee adoption rates and proactive change leadership
Change management excellence; employees drive AI transformation and continuously adapt to AI innovation

questions.title: AI-Augmented Workforce Strategy
questions.question: How effectively is your organization enhancing human capabilities with AI rather than simply replacing workers?

options.text: AI viewed primarily as replacement technology; limited consideration of human-AI collaboration
Some recognition of AI augmentation potential; beginning to explore human-AI collaboration models
Clear AI augmentation strategy; systematic approach to enhancing human capabilities with AI technologies
Advanced human-AI collaboration; employees effectively work with AI to enhance productivity and innovation
Seamless human-AI integration; AI amplifies human potential and creates new categories of work and value

questions.title: Innovation Culture and Continuous Learning
questions.question: How embedded is a culture of continuous learning and innovation related to AI in your organization?

options.text: Traditional learning culture; limited innovation initiatives and resistance to new AI approaches
Some innovation programs; beginning to encourage AI experimentation and learning initiatives
Innovation culture developing; systematic support for AI learning and experimentation across organization
Strong innovation culture; employees actively pursue AI learning and drive innovation initiatives
Innovation excellence; continuous learning and AI innovation drive organizational evolution and competitive advantage

questions.title: AI Talent and Leadership Development
questions.question: How effectively can your organization attract, develop, and retain AI talent and leadership?

options.text: Difficulty attracting AI talent; limited understanding of AI leadership requirements
Some success in AI talent acquisition; beginning to develop AI leadership capabilities
Effective AI talent strategy; developing internal AI expertise and leadership capabilities
Strong AI talent pipeline; excellent retention and development of AI leaders across organization
AI talent excellence; organization attracts top AI talent and develops industry-leading AI leaders

domains.name: Customer
domains.description: Customer experience enhancement, personalization, and value creation through agentic AI

questions.title: AI-Enhanced Customer Experience Across Channels
questions.question: How extensively does agentic AI enhance customer experiences across all your interaction channels?

options.text: No AI-enhanced customer interactions; traditional customer service and experience approaches
Basic AI applications in some customer touchpoints; limited integration across channels
AI consistently enhances customer experience; systematic implementation across multiple channels with measurable improvements
Advanced AI-driven customer experience; seamless integration across all channels with personalized interactions
AI transforms customer experience; autonomous AI agents provide exceptional, continuously improving customer interactions

questions.title: Dynamic Personalization and Tailored Solutions
questions.question: How effectively does your organization use AI to create personalized, tailored solutions for customers?

options.text: No personalization capabilities; one-size-fits-all approach to products and services
Basic segmentation with some customization; limited use of data for personalization
Systematic personalization using AI; targeted offerings based on customer segments and behavior patterns
Advanced personalization with micro-segmentation; AI-driven customization of products, pricing, and experiences
'Segments of one' personalization; AI creates unique, individual experiences and solutions for each customer in real-time

questions.title: Customer Insights and Predictive Capabilities
questions.question: How effectively do you use AI to generate actionable customer insights and predict customer needs?

options.text: Basic customer analytics without AI; limited insight generation and reactive customer management
Some AI-enhanced analytics; beginning to generate insights but limited predictive capabilities
AI-powered customer insights; predictive analytics driving proactive customer engagement and service improvements
Advanced predictive customer intelligence; AI anticipates customer needs and drives strategic decisions
Predictive customer excellence; AI generates deep insights that transform customer strategy and drive innovation

questions.title: Customer Satisfaction and Loyalty Impact
questions.question: What measurable improvements in customer satisfaction and loyalty have you achieved through AI implementations?

options.text: No measurable AI impact on customer satisfaction; traditional customer metrics without AI attribution
Some improvement in customer metrics; beginning to measure AI impact on customer satisfaction
Clear improvements in customer satisfaction; systematic measurement of AI impact with positive trending metrics
Significant customer satisfaction gains; strong improvement in loyalty metrics and customer lifetime value
Exceptional customer satisfaction results; industry-leading loyalty metrics and customer advocacy driven by AI

questions.title: Revenue Impact and Business Model Innovation
questions.question: How significantly does AI influence your revenue generation and enable new business model innovations?

options.text: No AI-influenced revenue; traditional business model without AI-enabled innovations
Limited AI impact on revenue; exploring potential for AI-enabled service offerings
Measurable AI-influenced revenue; some new offerings or efficiency gains contributing to financial performance
Significant AI-driven revenue growth; new business models and offerings generating substantial value
AI transforms business model; majority of revenue influenced by AI capabilities and continuous innovation

domains.name: Organization
domains.description: AI Center of Excellence development, process evolution, and delivery structure

questions.title: AI Center of Excellence Development
questions.question: How has your organization evolved process improvement capabilities to include agentic AI, and what dedicated AI delivery structure exists?

options.text: Traditional process improvement only; no dedicated AI organization or enhanced capabilities
Planning or building AI-enhanced process capabilities; beginning to design dedicated AI delivery structure
AI Center of Excellence established; formal structure with dedicated team focused on AI delivery and process automation
Mature AI CoE delivering measurable results; integrated process automation and AI capabilities across organization
Advanced AI CoE driving enterprise transformation; center of excellence leads industry innovation and organizational evolution

questions.title: Process Automation Breadth and Impact
questions.question: How extensively has your organization implemented AI-driven automation across core and non-core business functions?

options.text: Limited automation; manual processes dominate with minimal AI integration across functions
Some process automation in specific areas; beginning to identify opportunities across core and non-core functions
Systematic automation across multiple functions; AI-driven process improvements in both core and support functions
Extensive automation across organization; significant efficiency gains and process transformation through AI
Comprehensive AI-driven automation; intelligent processes that continuously optimize and adapt across all functions

questions.title: Cross-Functional AI Adoption and Integration
questions.question: How effectively does your AI organization coordinate and drive adoption across different business functions?

options.text: No cross-functional AI coordination; isolated efforts with limited organizational integration
Basic coordination between functions; beginning to standardize AI approaches across organization
Systematic cross-functional AI implementation; coordinated approach with consistent standards and practices
Seamless AI integration across functions; organization-wide adoption with unified AI strategy and execution
AI integration excellence; all functions leverage AI capabilities and drive continuous organizational innovation

questions.title: AI Delivery Capability and Expertise
questions.question: What level of internal capability exists for designing, implementing, and managing AI solutions?

options.text: Limited internal AI capability; heavy reliance on external vendors for any AI implementation
Basic internal AI capabilities; some expertise but still dependent on external support for complex solutions
Established internal AI expertise; capable of designing and implementing most AI solutions with selective external support
Advanced internal AI capabilities; comprehensive expertise enabling complex AI implementations and innovation
World-class AI delivery capabilities; internal expertise drives innovation and industry leadership in AI applications

questions.title: Organizational Impact and Value Delivery
questions.question: How effectively does your AI organization deliver measurable business value and drive organizational transformation?

options.text: No measurable AI business impact; limited value delivery and organizational influence
Some business value from AI initiatives; beginning to measure and communicate AI impact across organization
Clear business value delivery; systematic measurement and communication of AI benefits and organizational improvements
Significant organizational impact; AI delivery drives major business improvements and competitive advantages
Transformational organizational impact; AI capabilities fundamentally change how the organization operates and competes

levels1-2: Secure visible C-suite sponsorship and championship
Establish AI steering committee with cross-functional representation
Identify 3-5 high-impact use cases for initial value demonstration
Begin systematic AI literacy and training programs
Start designing AI Center of Excellence structure
Establish initial responsible AI guidelines and governance framework
level3: Scale successful pilots to enterprise-wide implementations
Formalize AI Center of Excellence with dedicated resources
Implement comprehensive governance framework with integrated oversight
Expand AI training programs across organization
Establish systematic measurement of AI business impact
Build internal AI development and deployment capabilities
levels4-5: Foster AI-first organizational culture and decision-making
Explore advanced agentic AI capabilities and business model innovations
Establish industry leadership position through AI differentiation
Drive continuous learning and adaptation to emerging AI technologies
Contribute to industry standards and regulatory development
Build ecosystem partnerships for AI innovation and scaling
